English: The authorities have not reported any injuries or property damage. 
 Japanese: 当局によると、けが人や財産被害は報告されていない。

English: The authorities have not reported any injuries or property damage. 
 Japanese: 8月には9日間の宗教的祝祭の2日目にヒマーチャル・プラデーシュ州のナイナ・デビ寺院でもうひとつパニックによる死亡事故があり、北インドでは130人以上がパニックのために死亡している。

English: As Tom DeLay's (Republican member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Texas), alleged ethical lapses began to dominate American political news stories and the Sunday talk shows, have led some Republican members of the Majority Leader’s own party to question the reasoning for his refusal to account for his actions or resign. 
 Japanese: 道徳の退廃がアメリカの政治ニュースや日曜日のトークショーを占拠し始めたと主張したトム・ディレイ（テキサス州の米国下院の共和党員）は、下院多数党院内総務の独自グループの共和党員を導いて自らの行動または辞職の説明を拒否する理由を議論させた。

English: As Tom DeLay's (Republican member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Texas), alleged ethical lapses began to dominate American political news stories and the Sunday talk shows, have led some Republican members of the Majority Leader’s own party to question the reasoning for his refusal to account for his actions or resign. 
 Japanese: けが人のほとんどは近くの病院に搬送され、残った巡礼者に対しては落ち着いて平和的であるよう呼びかけられている。

English: Last year, in a glimpse of problems yet to surface, the Republican head of the U.S. House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct, or "House Ethics Committee", presided over three admonitions that included offering to endorse the candidacy of a political lawmaker’s son in exchange for votes on legislation. 
 Japanese: 昨年、問題がまだ表面上に垣間見える間に、米国下院公務員行動基準委員会あるいは「下院倫理委員会」の共和党指導者は、法律制定への投票と引き換えに政治的立法者の子息の立候補の支援を申し出ることを含む3つの勧告を主宰した。

English: Last year, in a glimpse of problems yet to surface, the Republican head of the U.S. House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct, or "House Ethics Committee", presided over three admonitions that included offering to endorse the candidacy of a political lawmaker’s son in exchange for votes on legislation. 
 Japanese: ジョードプルの警察官、マリニ・アガーワル氏によれば、1万人以上のヒンズー教徒が寺院に集まり、宗教儀式を行おうとしていた。

English: The ethics complaints were originally filed by Democratic Rep. Chris Bell of Texas on June 15, 2004, and began to heat up in the months prior to last year's elections. 
 Japanese: 倫理上の苦情は、初めはテキサス州の民主党議員クリス・ベルによって2004年6月15日に提出され、昨年の選挙の数か月前から激しくなり始めた。

English: The ethics complaints were originally filed by Democratic Rep. Chris Bell of Texas on June 15, 2004, and began to heat up in the months prior to last year's elections. 
 Japanese: 何人かはまだがれきの下にとらわれていると考えられている。

English: A Texas grand jury is taking a hard look at Delay’s fund raising practices, and has already indicted three of his close associates. 
 Japanese: テキサス州大陪審は、ディレイの資金調達の実態を非常に注視していて、彼の側近3人をすでに起訴した。

English: A Texas grand jury is taking a hard look at Delay’s fund raising practices, and has already indicted three of his close associates. 
 Japanese: 寺院の壁が崩壊したことで、集まっていた数万人のヒンズー教礼拝者のパニックを引き起こし、彼らが安全のために逃げ出して集団事故につながった。

English: Last week the Washington Post reported that Mr. DeLay took a trip to Moscow in 1997, financed by lobbyists of the Russian Government. 
 Japanese: 先週ワシントンポストは、ディレイ氏が1997年にモスクワへ旅行に行き、ロシア政府のロビイストから資金提供を受けたと報告した。

English: Last week the Washington Post reported that Mr. DeLay took a trip to Moscow in 1997, financed by lobbyists of the Russian Government. 
 Japanese: インド西部のラージャスターン州ジョードプルにあるチャムンダ・デビ寺院で起きた巨大なパニックで、100人以上が死亡した。

English: Delay’s representative, Dan Allen, told reporters "Congressman DeLay's effective leadership to build and strengthen the House majority is exactly the reason he is being targeted by liberal groups funded by George Soros." 
 Japanese: ディレイの代理人であるダン・アレンは、「下院で多数派となって力を増した、ディレイ下院議員の効率的な指導力が、ジョージ・ソロスが資金提供している自由主義のグループの標的になっている本当の理由だ」と記者団に語った。

English: Delay’s representative, Dan Allen, told reporters "Congressman DeLay's effective leadership to build and strengthen the House majority is exactly the reason he is being targeted by liberal groups funded by George Soros." 
 Japanese: ロサンゼルス・ギャラクシーの敗北によって彼らはプレイオフから除外され、シカゴ・ファイアはプレイオフの第一ラウンドでDCユナイテッドとプレイする。

English: But Christopher Shays, a Republican from Connecticut, a Republican moderate, told the Associated Press that DeLay’s "conduct is hurting the Republican Party" and "hurting any Republican who is up for re-election [in 2006]." 
 Japanese: しかし、コネチカット州の共和党員で、穏健な党員であるクリストファー・シェイズはAP通信に、ディレイの「行為は共和党に損害を与えている」そして「（2006年の）再選挙に立候補している共和党員に損害を与えている」と語った。

English: But Christopher Shays, a Republican from Connecticut, a Republican moderate, told the Associated Press that DeLay’s "conduct is hurting the Republican Party" and "hurting any Republican who is up for re-election [in 2006]." 
 Japanese: シカゴ・ファイアは93分に決勝点を入れるまでシュートを大量に浴びせ、それが最終的な試合の決勝点となった。

English: The news agency reported that DeLay would look forward to meeting the charges with the ethics committee in a sit-down and blamed all of his problems on House Democrats. 
 Japanese: 報道機関は、ディレイが倫理委員会に着席して答弁するのを楽しみにしていると報じて、下院・民主党議員としての彼の全ての問題を非難した。

English: The news agency reported that DeLay would look forward to meeting the charges with the ethics committee in a sit-down and blamed all of his problems on House Democrats. 
 Japanese: ロサンゼルス・ギャラクシーは枠内シュートを1回、前半初めに記録しただけだった。

English: Senator Chris Dodd, a Democrat from Connecticut, advised his Republican colleagues strongly to "Be careful about how closely you embrace Mr. DeLay, as long as he's there, he's going to become a pretty good target." 
 Japanese: コネチカット州からの民主党の上院議員クリス・ドッドは、彼の共和党の同僚に、「ディレイ氏がそこにいる間は、彼との距離感に注意するべきで、彼はなかなか良い標的になるつもりだ」と強く忠告した。

English: Senator Chris Dodd, a Democrat from Connecticut, advised his Republican colleagues strongly to "Be careful about how closely you embrace Mr. DeLay, as long as he's there, he's going to become a pretty good target." 
 Japanese: シカゴ・ファイアは試合を支配し、ロサンゼルス・ギャラクシーより多くシュートを打ってシュート数22対5とした。

English: Those Republicans working with the Majority Leader said his ethics are only a problem to Democrats trying to regain power in the House. 
 Japanese: 多数党院内総務と共に勤務している共和党員は、下院で勢力を取り戻そうとしている民主党員にとって彼の倫理のみが問題であると言った。

English: Those Republicans working with the Majority Leader said his ethics are only a problem to Democrats trying to regain power in the House. 
 Japanese: 最終的に、シカゴ・ファイアがロサンゼルス・ギャラクシーを破り最後のプレイオフ出場権を手にした。

English: But the Ethics Committee’s membership is equally divided between Republicans and Democrats. 
 Japanese: しかし、倫理委員会のメンバーは共和党員と民主党員がちょうど半分ずつである。

English: But the Ethics Committee’s membership is equally divided between Republicans and Democrats.

English: Other Republicans are starting to get jittery about their reelection hopes if DeLay is allowed to retain power.

English: Other Republicans are starting to get jittery about their reelection hopes if DeLay is allowed to retain power.

English: Tom's conduct is hurting the Republican Party, is hurting this Republican majority and it is hurting any Republican who is up for re-election, Rep. Christopher Shays, R-Conn., told the Associated Press after making similar comments at community meetings in his home district this weekend. 
 Japanese: トムの行為は共和党に損害を与えていて、共和党員の大多数に損害を与えていて、再選に立候補する共和党員に損害を与えている、とコネチカット州の共和党員で下院議員クリストファー・シェイズは、この週末に地元の地域集会で同じようなコメントをした後で、AP通信に語った。

English: Tom's conduct is hurting the Republican Party, is hurting this Republican majority and it is hurting any Republican who is up for re-election, Rep. Christopher Shays, R-Conn., told the Associated Press after making similar comments at community meetings in his home district this weekend.

English: The third-ranking Republican in the Senate, Rick Santorum of Pennsylvania, said DeLay needs to "clear the air."

English: The third-ranking Republican in the Senate, Rick Santorum of Pennsylvania, said DeLay needs to "clear the air."

English: But he thinks everything done by DeLay was "according to the law."

English: I think he has to come forward and lay out what he did and why he did it and let the people then judge for themselves, he said on ABC's This Week, a Sunday political talk program. 
 Japanese: 私は、彼は表に出て自分が行ったこととその理由を明示して、人々に彼ら自身の判断をしてもらうべきだと考える、と彼はABCの日曜日の政治トーク番組で語った。

English: I think he has to come forward and lay out what he did and why he did it and let the people then judge for themselves, he said on ABC's This Week, a Sunday political talk program.

English: Now you may not like some of the things he's done, that’s for the people of his district to decide, whether they want to approve that kind of behavior.

English: The European Space Agency (ESA) reported on Friday that the Wilkins Shelf, an enormous Antarctic ice shelf half the size of Scotland, could break away from the continent very soon.

English: The European Space Agency (ESA) reported on Friday that the Wilkins Shelf, an enormous Antarctic ice shelf half the size of Scotland, could break away from the continent very soon.

English: This is the largest shelf of ice so far to have disintegrated in the Antarctic.

English: In February 2008, the shelf lost 425 square kilometres (164 square miles) of ice, followed by a loss of another 62 square miles in May 2008.

English: In February 2008, the shelf lost 425 square kilometres (164 square miles) of ice, followed by a loss of another 62 square miles in May 2008.

English: During the last year the ice shelf has lost about 1800 square kilometers (694 square miles), or about 14 percent of its size, said Angelika Humbert from the Institute of Geophysics at University of Münster in Germany. 
 Japanese: 昨年中に氷棚は約1800平方キロメートル（694平方マイル）、全体の約14パーセントを失った、とドイツのミュンスター大学の地球物理学研究所のアンジェリカ・ハンバートは述べた。

English: During the last year the ice shelf has lost about 1800 square kilometers (694 square miles), or about 14 percent of its size, said Angelika Humbert from the Institute of Geophysics at University of Münster in Germany.

English: Scientists say that the shelf, if it detaches from the mainland, won't cause an increase in sea levels, as it is already floating.

English: Scientists say that the shelf, if it detaches from the mainland, won't cause an increase in sea levels, as it is already floating.

 Japanese: 科学者の多くは、この出来事は地球温暖化のさらなる証拠だと思っている。

English: Average temperatures in the Antarctic peninsula have increased by about 2.5 degrees Celsius (3.8 degrees Fahrenheit) in the past fifty years.

English: Britain's Secretary of State for Health, John Reid, is amongst those calling for the withdrawal of Conservative candidate for Dorset South, Ed Matts, after he doctored photos in campaign literature. 
 Japanese: 英国保健大臣ジョン・リードは、キャンペーン用の印刷物の写真を細工したことで、ドーセット州南部の保守党候補のエド・Mattsの立候補の撤回を求めている一人である。

English: Britain's Secretary of State for Health, John Reid, is amongst those calling for the withdrawal of Conservative candidate for Dorset South, Ed Matts, after he doctored photos in campaign literature. 
 Japanese: ベン氏は彼がつねにBBCの支持者だったと言い、昨日はそれを救急サービスと比較した。

English: The photo in question originally showed Matts and the Conservative front-bencher Anne Widdecombe campaigning on behalf of an immigrant family living in Weymouth, in the Dorset South constituency, in March last year. 
 Japanese: 問題の写真は、元々は昨年3月に南ドーセット選挙区で、ウェイマスに住む移民家族のためにキャンペーン中のMattsと保守党幹部アン・Widdecombeを撮ったものである。

English: The photo in question originally showed Matts and the Conservative front-bencher Anne Widdecombe campaigning on behalf of an immigrant family living in Weymouth, in the Dorset South constituency, in March last year. 
 Japanese: ファンはそのシングルをプロモートするためのふたつのFacebookグループを作り、イギリスのシングルチャートで良い位置を獲得しようとしているが、そうなればBBCの商業的競合他社はその曲を放送せざるをえなくなるだろう。

English: When the photo appeared in Matts' campaign literature, the people in the background were removed from the photo and a slogan calling for the family to be allowed to stay was replaced by one calling for immigration control. 
 Japanese: 写真がMattsのキャンペーン用の印刷物に載った時、背後の人々は写真から削除され、家族が居住を許されることを求めたスローガンは出入国管理に対するものに置き換えられた。

English: When the photo appeared in Matts' campaign literature, the people in the background were removed from the photo and a slogan calling for the family to be allowed to stay was replaced by one calling for immigration control.

English: The seat, taken by Labour's Jim Knight in the 2001 general election, is one of the most fiercely contested in the country, being Labour's smallest majority. 
 Japanese: 労働党がもっとも僅差で勝ち越した2001年の総選挙で労働党のジム・ナイトが得た議席は、国内でもっとも激しい争いの一つである。

English: The seat, taken by Labour's Jim Knight in the 2001 general election, is one of the most fiercely contested in the country, being Labour's smallest majority. 
 Japanese: その歌は月曜日に「ダウンロードのみ」の曲として正式リリースされた。

English: Conservative leader Michael Howard condemned Matts' behaviour but refused to sack him.

English: Conservative leader Michael Howard condemned Matts' behaviour but refused to sack him.

English: Conservative shadow Chancellor Oliver Letwin, from neighbouring Dorset West, said that the message on the doctored photo was consistent with conservative policy.

 Japanese: マグニチュード7.0以上の海底地震が来週もう一度予測されているので、サハリン島はまた津波に備える必要があるかもしれない。

English: At approximately 1230 UTC/0730 EST, the first explosion occurred outside the crowded Sankat Mochan temple. 
 Japanese: 最初の爆発は協定世界時12時30分/東部標準時07時30分頃に、人でごった返しているSankatMochan寺の外で起こった。

English: At approximately 1230 UTC/0730 EST, the first explosion occurred outside the crowded Sankat Mochan temple. 
 Japanese: サハリン島には金曜日に津波警報が出されたが、すぐに解除された。

English: The second took place just minutes later at the Cantonment Railway Station, leaving a crater just outside the stationmaster's room, and the third occurred on the Shiv Ganga Express, which had been leaving for New Delhi. 
 Japanese: ２番目の爆発は数分後にCantonment鉄道駅で起こって駅長室の外に穴を残し、３番目はニューデリーに向けて出発したShivGanga特急で起こった。

English: The second took place just minutes later at the Cantonment Railway Station, leaving a crater just outside the stationmaster's room, and the third occurred on the Shiv Ganga Express, which had been leaving for New Delhi. 
 Japanese: そのため、このようなケースでは通常けがや死亡者は出ない。

English: Officials say that the area has been cordoned off and the injured have been shifted to a hospital on the Benaras Hindu University campus. 
 Japanese: 担当者は、その地域は立ち入り禁止になり、負傷者はベナレス・ヒンズー大学のキャンパスにある病院に運ばれたと述べた。

English: Officials say that the area has been cordoned off and the injured have been shifted to a hospital on the Benaras Hindu University campus.

English: They also report that at least four unexploded bombs were found near a holy site by the Ganges River. 
 Japanese: また、少なくとも４つの不発弾がガンジス川の聖地の近くで発見されたと報告した。

English: They also report that at least four unexploded bombs were found near a holy site by the Ganges River. 
 Japanese: これはいわゆる深発地震で、そのためこれほど大規模な範囲で感じられた。

English: According to media advisor Sanjay Baru, Prime Minister Manmohan "has appealed for peace and calm.

English: According to media advisor Sanjay Baru, Prime Minister Manmohan "has appealed for peace and calm.

English: Taiwan electronics giant Foxconn has moved to repair its reputation after the suicide of a tenth employee this year, two others having survived attempted suicides. 
 Japanese: 台湾の巨大電子企業フォックスコンは、今年、従業員１０人の自殺、２人の自殺未遂の後、評判を回復するために動き始めた。

English: Taiwan electronics giant Foxconn has moved to repair its reputation after the suicide of a tenth employee this year, two others having survived attempted suicides. 
 Japanese: モスクワ市民は、振動は「あまり強くなかった」が、壁にかけたものが揺れるのには十分だったと言った。

English: The latest death came on the same day as Terry Gou, Chairman of Foxconn's parent Hon Hai Precision, opened the Shenzen production facility to the media for the first time. 
 Japanese: 最後の死は、フォックスコンの親会社である鴻海精密工業の会長のTerryGou氏が深?生産施設をメディアに最初に公開したその日に起きた。

English: The latest death came on the same day as Terry Gou, Chairman of Foxconn's parent Hon Hai Precision, opened the Shenzen production facility to the media for the first time. 
 Japanese: その地震はオホーツク海の水面下600kmで起こり、リヒター・スケールでマグニチュード8.2を記録、モスクワでの揺れは同スケールで1.0だった。

English: In the face of accusations that he ran a modern day sweatshop, he showed off employee recreation facilities. 
 Japanese: 現代の労働搾取工場を運営しているという告訴を受け、彼は従業員のレクリエーション施設を誇示した。

English: In the face of accusations that he ran a modern day sweatshop, he showed off employee recreation facilities. 
 Japanese: 金曜日、ロシアのカムチャッカ半島東岸近くの海底地震が、1万km離れた首都モスクワで感じられた。

English: Gou, bowing as an expression of regret, promised to work to prevent such tragedies occurring again. 
 Japanese: Gou氏は悔悟の表現として頭を下げながら、そのような悲劇が二度と起こらないようにすると約束した。

English: Gou, bowing as an expression of regret, promised to work to prevent such tragedies occurring again. 
 Japanese: より大きな工場が深セン市にあるが、その穴埋めに対応できるほどではない、と彼らは言った。

English: Although not a household name, Foxconn is the largest producer of electronics components and badge engineered electronics products in the world, manufacturing products for companies like Apple, Hewlett-Packard, Intel and Dell. 
 Japanese: 名前はあまり知られていないが、フォックスコンは世界最大の電子部品とバッジエンジニアリングエレクトロニクス製品の製造会社であり、アップルやヒューレット・パッカードやインテルやデルのような会社のために製品を生産している。

English: Although not a household name, Foxconn is the largest producer of electronics components and badge engineered electronics products in the world, manufacturing products for companies like Apple, Hewlett-Packard, Intel and Dell. 
 Japanese: 調査グループのIHSiSuppliは、その爆発によって今年この四半期中、50万台のiPadの生産が失われるかもしれないと言った。

English: ”Apple is deeply committed to ensuring that conditions throughout our supply chain are safe and workers are treated with respect and dignity”, said Steve Dowling, an Apple spokesperson. 
 Japanese: アップルのスポークスマンであるスティーブ・ダウリングは、「アップルはサプライチェーン全体のコンディションが安全で、労働者が尊敬と威厳をもって遇されるように保証することを約束する」と述べた。

English: ”Apple is deeply committed to ensuring that conditions throughout our supply chain are safe and workers are treated with respect and dignity”, said Steve Dowling, an Apple spokesperson. 
 Japanese: フォックスコンは、そのグループが「悲惨な事故を利用」しようとしており、「フォックスコンによる従業員の健康と安全への献身」を誤って述べていると言って対応した。

English: Allen Pu of Fubon Securities said: "Hon Hai needs to resolve the issue because the situation is also negative for Apple and HP. 
 Japanese: 富邦警備のAllenPu氏は、「鴻海はこの問題を解決しなければならない、なぜなら、状況はアップルにもHPにもネガティブだから」と述べた。

English: Allen Pu of Fubon Securities said: "Hon Hai needs to resolve the issue because the situation is also negative for Apple and HP. 
 Japanese: 「作業者が木綿の手袋を外すと、彼らの手はアルミニウムの粉塵に覆われている。」

English: Labor activists have criticised conditions at Foxconn's factories as "military-style", with workers working long shifts and not being able to speak to each other. 
 Japanese: 労働運動家は、フォックスコンの工場では労働者は長時間働き、互いにおしゃべりすることもできず、まるで「軍隊式」だと批判している。

English: Labor activists have criticised conditions at Foxconn's factories as "military-style", with workers working long shifts and not being able to speak to each other. 
 Japanese: 「作業者はマスクを着けていてもアルミニウムの粉塵をつねに吸い込んでいる。」

English: However, Foxconn claims that the suicides were mostly the result of relationship problems unrelated to its own management style, and it argues that for a work force so large the number of suicides is small. 
 Japanese: しかしながら、フォックスコンは、自殺のほとんどが経営スタイルとは関係のない人間関係の結果であり、労働者の数にくらべて自殺者の数は少ないと主張している。

English: However, Foxconn claims that the suicides were mostly the result of relationship problems unrelated to its own management style, and it argues that for a work force so large the number of suicides is small. 
 Japanese: 「作業中、アルミニウムの粉塵が空気中にたくさん浮いている。」

English: Police have found the body of a man they had been hunting in Cumbria, United Kingdom for a series of shootings. 
 Japanese: 英国のカンブリアで、一連の銃撃事件の捜査をしていた警察が男の死体を発見した。

English: Police have found the body of a man they had been hunting in Cumbria, United Kingdom for a series of shootings. 
 Japanese: 爆発の後、彼らは労働者が「その部門での換気が悪い」と不満を言っていたとコメントした。

English: Police later confirmed that twelve people had been killed with a further thirteen injured, three critically. 
 Japanese: 警察は、１２人が殺され、１３人以上が負傷し、そのうち３人が重態だと確認した。

English: Police later confirmed that twelve people had been killed with a further thirteen injured, three critically. 
 Japanese: 香港を拠点とする労働者権利グループ「企業の不正に反対する学生と研究者の会」は、彼らが3月にフォックスコンでの労働条件を評価したとき、アルミニウムの粉塵の問題を報告していたと言った。

English: Shots were fired in Whitehaven, Seascale and Egremont, with a total of thirty different crime scenes. 
 Japanese: ホワイトヘブン、シースケール、エグルモントでなど全体で３０の異なる犯罪現場で銃撃が起こった。

English: Shots were fired in Whitehaven, Seascale and Egremont, with a total of thirty different crime scenes. 
 Japanese: 月曜日、市当局は研磨作業場での空気中の可燃性粉塵に原因があるとした。

English: The Sellafield nuclear reprocessing plant was locked down for the first time in its history. 
 Japanese: セラフィールド核再処理工場は歴史上初めてロックダウンされた。

English: The Sellafield nuclear reprocessing plant was locked down for the first time in its history.

English: The prime suspect was named as 52 year old local man Derrick Bird, a taxi driver. 
 Japanese: 有力な容疑者は５２歳の地元の男でタクシー運転手デリック・バードだと公表された。

English: The prime suspect was named as 52 year old local man Derrick Bird, a taxi driver. 
 Japanese: フォックスコンは調査のために生産を停止して「影響を受けた作業場ではすべての作業が停止されており、同様の加工機能を実施する他のすべての作業場での生産も調査結果が出るまで停止される」と言った。

English: The first of Bird's victims was a fellow taxi driver shot in Whitehaven at about 10.30 local time, with the following victims being shot at random as Bird drove down the west coast. 
 Japanese: バードの最初の犠牲者は同僚のタクシー運転手で、地元時間の約１０時３０分ごろにホワイトヘブンで撃たれ、次の犠牲者たちは西海岸に向かって車で走るバードに手当たり次第に撃たれた。

English: The first of Bird's victims was a fellow taxi driver shot in Whitehaven at about 10.30 local time, with the following victims being shot at random as Bird drove down the west coast. 
 Japanese: 少なくとも3人が死亡、少なくとも15人がけがをした。

English: Originally driving a Citroën Picasso, he was later said to be on foot when he crashed his vehicle. 
 Japanese: 最初はシトロエン・ピカソを運転していたが、車をぶつけた後は歩いていたと言う。

English: Originally driving a Citroën Picasso, he was later said to be on foot when he crashed his vehicle. 
 Japanese: 爆発が起きたのは午後7時18分、作業者のシフトが入れ替わる頃だった。

English: Members of the public were advised by police to stay indoors, and for those who saw him not to approach him, but to call them. 
 Japanese: 警察は一般の人々に、室内にとどまるよう、また、彼を見ても近づかないで警察を呼ぶよう助言した。

English: Members of the public were advised by police to stay indoors, and for those who saw him not to approach him, but to call them. 
 Japanese: 最初の調査では、その爆発が不十分な換気により起きたものだと示唆されている。

English: The manhunt covered the Boot or Scafell Pike area, and at 14:04 BST (13:04 UTC) the Deputy Chief Constable of Cumbria reported that a body believed to be Bird was found in a wood near Boot with a firearm, and that he had turned the weapon on himself. 
 Japanese: 犯人捜査はブートやスカフェルパイク地区をカバーし、英国夏時間の１４時４分（協定世界時の１３時４分）にカンブリアの巡査次長が、バードのものと思われる遺体がブートの近くの森で銃器とともに発見され、武器は自分に向けられていたと報告した。

English: The manhunt covered the Boot or Scafell Pike area, and at 14:04 BST (13:04 UTC) the Deputy Chief Constable of Cumbria reported that a body believed to be Bird was found in a wood near Boot with a firearm, and that he had turned the weapon on himself. 
 Japanese: 金曜日夕方、中国の成都市での爆発によって、世界最大の家電メーカーでありヒューレット・パッカードやソニー、アップル、ノキアへの主要サプライヤーであるフォックスコンが運営する工場が部分的に閉鎖された。

English: The affected area is popular with walkers and hikers, and currently, many schools across England are on half term, meaning the pupils have no classes. 
 Japanese: 場所は歩行者やハイカーで人気のある地域で、現在は、イギリスの多くの学校が半期で、生徒は授業を受けていない。

English: The affected area is popular with walkers and hikers, and currently, many schools across England are on half term, meaning the pupils have no classes. 
 Japanese: ウィナー・インターナショナルの広報担当者は声明で「（今は）我々すべてにとって非常に困難なときで、ご遺族はみなさんにプライバシーを尊重してくれることを求めたいと思っています」と言った。

English: British news network BBC News spoke to several eye-witnesses in relation to the incidents, from each of the areas, including Peter Watson of Whitehaven. 
 Japanese: イギリスのニュースネットのBBCニュースは、ブンホワイトヘブンのピーター・ワトソンを含む、それぞれの地域で事件に関わった何人かの目撃者にインタビューした。

English: British news network BBC News spoke to several eye-witnesses in relation to the incidents, from each of the areas, including Peter Watson of Whitehaven. 
 Japanese: ウィナー氏はまた複数のホテルや鉄工会社1社、その他複数の企業を所有していた。

English: When I first got here it must have just happened. 
 Japanese: わたしが最初にここに着いたとき、それは起こったばかりだったにちがいない。

English: When I first got here it must have just happened. 
 Japanese: 彼は最初のClubをペンシルバニア州で販売し、その後ウィナー・インターナショナルを創業して1000万台以上を売り上げた。

English: There was a man lying on the ground with police stood over him and a jacket on him, he reported. 
 Japanese: 地面に横たわっている男がいて、警官が見張っていて、ジャケットをかぶせた、と彼は報告した。

English: There was a man lying on the ground with police stood over him and a jacket on him, he reported. 
 Japanese: 彼は朝鮮戦争で戦闘中にそのアイデアを思いついており、自分の車を金属の鎖で止めて誰もそれを盗めないようにした。

English: Home Secretary Theresa May is due to make a statement on the incident to the House of Commons tomorrow. 
 Japanese: テレサ・メイ内務大臣が明日、下院に事件について声明を出すことになっている。

English: Home Secretary Theresa May is due to make a statement on the incident to the House of Commons tomorrow. 
 Japanese: ウィナー氏はハンドルロックのTheClubを80年代初期、彼の車が盗まれたときに作り出した。

English: Construction workers and next of kin of deceased workers filed a lawsuit in Tokyo, Japan Friday seeking damages of approximately 6.6 billion yen (about US$64 million) from the government and manufacturers related to illnesses stemming from exposure to asbestos. 
 Japanese: 建設労働者および亡くなった労働者の近親者が、日本の東京で、金曜日、アスベストにさらされたことから生じる疾病に関係のある政府や企業に約６６億円（約６４００万ドル）の損害賠償を求める集団訴訟を起こした。

English: Construction workers and next of kin of deceased workers filed a lawsuit in Tokyo, Japan Friday seeking damages of approximately 6.6 billion yen (about US$64 million) from the government and manufacturers related to illnesses stemming from exposure to asbestos. 
 Japanese: その事故は、ウィナー氏が彼のSUVを対向車線に走らせて起こったと当局は言っている。

English: 178 plaintiffs; including construction workers and family members filed the suit in Tokyo District Court against 46 building manufacturers and the Government of Japan. 
 Japanese: 建設労働者と家族を含む１７８名の原告が、東京地方裁判所で、４６の建設業者と日本政府に対して訴訟を起こした。

English: 178 plaintiffs; including construction workers and family members filed the suit in Tokyo District Court against 46 building manufacturers and the Government of Japan. 
 Japanese: ハンドルロック「TheClub」の発明者、ジェームズ・E・ウィナー氏が、今日ペンシルバニア州のクラリオン郡で車の正面衝突事故で81歳で亡くなった。

English: According to the Mainichi Daily News, the class action suit is the first that has been filed in Japan related to health damages caused by asbestos exposure at construction sites. 
 Japanese: 毎日デイリーニューズによると、建設現場でアスベストにさらされたことによる健康被害に関して日本で起こされた最初の集団訴訟である。

English: According to the Mainichi Daily News, the class action suit is the first that has been filed in Japan related to health damages caused by asbestos exposure at construction sites. 
 Japanese: 現在の国防大臣、ジョン・レイド氏がクラーク氏の後任で新内務大臣となり、ジャック・ストロー氏が下院院内総務となる。

English: The plaintiffs hail from the Japanese prefectures of Tokyo, Saitama and Chiba. 
 Japanese: 原告は日本の東京都、埼玉県、千葉県の出身である。

English: The plaintiffs hail from the Japanese prefectures of Tokyo, Saitama and Chiba. 
 Japanese: このニュースは、1000人以上の外国の囚人が刑期終了時に送還されず、間違って釈放されていた事態による過去2週間の報道に続くものだ。

English: The plaintiffs claim that the government and manufacturers knew of the dangers of asbestos inhalation but failed to take proper precautions, including ceasing to promote asbestos as a cheap fire retardant and banning production of the material. 
 Japanese: 原告は政府と企業がアスベスト吸入の危険を知りながら適切な警告をすることに失敗し、安価な火災遅延材料としてアスベストを奨励するのを中止せず、材料の生産を禁止しなかったと主張している。

English: The plaintiffs claim that the government and manufacturers knew of the dangers of asbestos inhalation but failed to take proper precautions, including ceasing to promote asbestos as a cheap fire retardant and banning production of the material. 
 Japanese: 英国の内務大臣チャールズ・クラーク氏は、労働党がイギリス全土での地域選挙で議席を失った翌朝、トニー・ブレア氏による内閣改造でその地位を失った。

English: They state that after inhaling asbestos in the workplace, 172 people have developed lung cancer or mesothelioma, and that almost half of those afflicted are now dead. 
 Japanese: 職場でアスベストを吸入した後、１７２人が肺がんや中皮腫になり、そのうちほぼ半数が死亡したと述べている。

English: They state that after inhaling asbestos in the workplace, 172 people have developed lung cancer or mesothelioma, and that almost half of those afflicted are now dead. 
 Japanese: 12月のPPPの調査では、ニューメキシコ州でジョンソン氏が23％の支持を受け、三つ巴の戦いとなっている。

English: Plaintiffs argue that the government and health ministry did not act quickly enough after international organizations issued warnings in 1972 that asbestos could be a carcinogen. 
 Japanese: 原告は、政府と厚生省が国際機関が１９７２年にアスベストの発がん性を警告した後も早急に行動しなかったと論じている。

English: Plaintiffs argue that the government and health ministry did not act quickly enough after international organizations issued warnings in 1972 that asbestos could be a carcinogen. 
 Japanese: 最近のパブリック・ポリシー・ポーリング（PPP）による調査では、ジョンソン氏が6％の全国的支持を受け、バラク・オバマ大統領や共和党の推薦を得るであろうミット・ロムニー氏と戦っている。

English: Plaintiffs also place blame with the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry for sanctioning the use of asbestos under Japanese Industrial Standards, and with the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport for approving the use of materials comprised of asbestos and other substances under Japan's Building Standards Law. 
 Japanese: 原告はまた、経済産業省が日本工業規格のもとでアスベストの使用を認可したこと、国土交通省が日本の建築基準法のもとで、アスベストや他の物質を含む材料の使用を推奨したことを非難している。

English: Plaintiffs also place blame with the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry for sanctioning the use of asbestos under Japanese Industrial Standards, and with the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport for approving the use of materials comprised of asbestos and other substances under Japan's Building Standards Law. 
 Japanese: 2008年、リバタリアン党は45州の州投票に登場し、バー氏が一般投票の0.4％を得票した。

English: ”We will do our utmost until we win the suit”, said Kazuo Miyajima, 78, who heads the group of plaintiffs. 
 Japanese: 原告団のリーダーである宮島和男氏（78歳）は、「訴訟に勝利するまでわれわれのできるだけのことをする」と述べた。

English: ”We will do our utmost until we win the suit”, said Kazuo Miyajima, 78, who heads the group of plaintiffs. 
 Japanese: グレイ氏はその文章やメディア露出の中で、薬物との戦いに反対する立場で活動している。

English: Lawyers for the plaintiffs released a statement saying: "We seek complete relief for the victims by clarifying the liability of the state and the manufacturers." 
 Japanese: 原告の弁護士は、「われわれは国家と企業の嘘を明らかにすることによって犠牲者の完全な救済を求める」との声明を発表した。

English: Lawyers for the plaintiffs released a statement saying: "We seek complete relief for the victims by clarifying the liability of the state and the manufacturers." 
 Japanese: 彼は1998年に共和党員として議員選挙に出馬し、リバタリアン党の2004年のカリフォルニア州の米国上院議員候補となった。

English: Approximately 40 construction workers from Kanagawa Prefecture plan to file a similar lawsuit in June in Yokohama District Court. 
 Japanese: 神奈川県の約４０名の建設労働者が六月に横浜地方裁判所に同じような訴訟を起こす計画である。

English: Approximately 40 construction workers from Kanagawa Prefecture plan to file a similar lawsuit in June in Yokohama District Court. 
 Japanese: グレイ氏は法律専門家で、1983年以来カリフォルニア州オレンジカウンティの公判裁判官を務めてきた。

English: After a 2005 revelation that residents who lived near a factory in Amagasaki, Hyogo Prefecture developed diseases related to asbestos, the government implemented a law in 2006 which provides monetary assistance to asbestos victims and relatives of deceased family members.
